review_title: I have worked here for 5 years and I will never work for HCA every again.
job_title: Tier II PRN RN in Tallahassee, FL
pros: Overtime is always available and there are bonus plans you can sign up for. PRN staff can work full time hours and get paid alot more. But you do not get any benefits besides a 401k.
cons: This place is all about making money. They could care less about thier staff. The turn over rate is extremely high. Charge nurses often have full teams. Icu nurses are often tripled. You will be written up to prevent a transfer from occuring. Acuity means nothing. If there is an open bed then you will take a patient regardless if you have the proper staffing or not. Frequently short staffed. They like to employ mostly new nurses they can pay very little starting around 19 an hour and who will not question thier orders. The administrators support each other and they DO NOT HAVE YOUR BACK. Stay away!!

job_title: Copy Center Manager in Tallahassee, FL
pros: I love the people I work with.
cons: EHR is still based off a DOS system from the 1980s. The staffing ratios are extremely unsafe - sometimes 7:1. The managers are two-faced, definitely say one thing and do another. They treat people like they don't matter unless you're in their little clique. We are always out if supplies everytime I work. The food is horrible!

job_title: Medical Records Technician in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Most of the staff are friendly and take the care of their patients seriously.  If facing surgery, the nurses and techs are excellent at putting the patient an Family at ease.
cons: Too much drama in the department I worked in.  The Manager of the department I worked in had certain employees who were her favorites and any one she didn't feel she could mold to be her "lap dog" she would set them up so they would either quit or be fired.

pros: You are able to get as many hours as you would like. New grads are always welcomed and can get plenty of experience...hopefully you don't lose your license in the process. Most staff become a close unit due to need to work well together to make it through mostly stressful shifts.
cons: The reason hours are so plentiful is due to the turnover rate...no care about safety and patient/staff satisfaction. No lie...you will be working mostly stressed out and dissatisfied. Hopefully you have great teammates.

review_title: Must be able to hold your own and speak up, not a good place for a new nurse fresh out of school.
pros: Lots of overtime available. Nurse can make 6 figures working overtime. Able to move around within the hospital
cons: Frequent changes in management, not enough nurse or cna's at times. Pts not assigned based on acuity. If there is an empty bed a patient will go there despite how heavy your team is.

review_title: This Hospital Only Cares about their bottom line
pros: Nursing staff and other disciplines work well together. There is an emphasis on improving technology and being the hospital of the future so they do replace equipment with latest models fairly often.
cons: Constantly understaffed and asking nursing staff to “surge” to dangerous ratios. Administration does not have your back if you try to refuse to take a patient that will make your team unsafe. There is so much focus on improving technology and patient satisfaction scores that there’s not much emphasis on safe patient care. Overall a very frustrating company to work for.

job_title: Critical Care RN in Tallahassee, FL
pros: Very clean beautiful facility. High tech with modern amenities.  Pharmacist assigned to unit. Very dynamic director. Everyone is so nice and friendly.  Cafeteria is very good.
cons: Nursing ratios seem softer than other facilities. Pay is soft but on the front end offers substantial bonuses and moving expenses.

job_title: Emergency Department Technician in Tallahassee, FL
pros:
- steady schedule
- fun coworkers, great team to work with
- rarely bored
- patient satisfaction is important
cons:
- as is common in all ERs, can be very busy, patients in hallways, etc, which adds stress
- patient "satisfaction" is sometimes overly prioritized
